chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin S Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. Costs and DNA PAID IN FULL.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Center for Diagnostic Imaging or Dr. Michelle M., or Dr. Jesse V.B.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin S Taylor in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 6. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 6:
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months  (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 2 years Probation - Sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee County
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 - APPLY BAIL AND REFUND BALANCE 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 - APPLY BAIL AND REFUND BALANCE
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Center for Diagnostic Imaging or Dr. Michelle M. or Dr. Jesse V. B..    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided ,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a condition of probation.
- 120 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 08/21/2015 by 4:00 p.m.. Five days credit.   Non-working hours with standard release Conditions.  Last 30 days jail  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. Sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee County. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Sentencing hearing on August 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
